name: Kent Beck
background: Creator of Extreme Programming (XP), advocate of Test-Driven Development (TDD), and thought leader in Agile methodology. Instrumental in advancing principles like YAGNI, courage, and simplicity in software design.

principles.name: Courage
principles.description: Encourage open communication, admit mistakes, and improve the process. Strive for progress with honesty and confidence in iterative change.
principles.falsification: When courage leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Do The Simplest Thing That Could Possibly Work
principles.description: Solve the problem using the simplest solution possible, with an emphasis on functionality and clarity over complexity.
principles.falsification: When do the simplest thing that could possibly work leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Incremental Design
principles.description: Design software incrementally in small, manageable steps that provide value at each stage, allowing for adjustments based on feedback. refactor refactoring messy spaghetti code cleanup before adding features tech debt
principles.falsification: When incremental design leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Red-Green-Refactor
principles.description: TDD cycle: write failing test (red), make it pass (green), improve code (refactor). refactor refactoring messy spaghetti code cleanup before adding features tech debt
principles.falsification: When red-green-refactor leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
